creditline: The James Ford Bell Foundation Endowment for Art Acquisition
inscription: paper label verso, lower trunk: 3 / Emanuel
signed: paper label verso, lower trunk: IWIN.IGI / [illeg.] / 180 x 050 x 020 / Mestre Didi /  Salv. Ba. 1998
text: Standing over six feet tall and extending over one foot to the right and left, Majestoso ancestral da árvore is at once a commanding and playful figure. Made of palm fronds bound in colorfully painted leather and adorned with cowrie shells, this totemic sculpture entices the viewer with its tassels and delicate patterning while maintaining an impressive presence. Created by Deoscóredes Maximiliano dos Santos, better known as Mestre Didi–a renowned artist, author, and spiritual leader–the sculpture powerfully channels Didi’s faith traditions in its evocation of the ancestral figures central to his faith, Candomblé, a West African diasporic religion developed in Brazil.
title: IWIN IGI NLA - Majestoso ancestral da árvore
